column4: Hi! When i click right click on panel i have only "help" and "about panels". Does anybody know how to add new panel?
really? never seen that before. Any idea what happened?
i could make screenshot if you want.. i tried google it but found nothing useful
tried to reset the panels completely? gconftool --recursive-unset /apps/panel && killall gnome-panel
i didnt know about this, but i did it right now and nothing changed :(
too bad. Since that's the way to reset "to factory defaults".. Actually i have no clue what could cause this. Any recent changes?
the problem is i dont know WHEN this happend... i didnt used it lately.. last things i installed is conky and i removed some old kernels, but this shuldnt have something with kernel...
agreed. It must be something in the gnome (-panel) config. But with previous command you reset it w/out result. (btw Those settings are saved in your homedir in ~/.gconf/apps/panel)
ok, thank you very much.. i'll try to do some googling and try to understand settings in my home to fix it
Sure. Gnome has config options (somewhat similar to registry) You can see that yourself by starting "gconf-editor" (and in this case browse to apps > panel)
there is one line different and it deletes settings folder, as i can see
that's what did the trick probably
to tell you the truth im not happy that i have fixed it couse i dont know what couse probelm, i wish i had backuped that folder first :S
well i have to go, thanks once again for tring to help me. have a nice day, good bye
